Module org.postgresql.pljava.internal
Package org.postgresql.pljava.jdbc

Class SQLXMLImpl<V extends Datum>

java.lang.Object
org.postgresql.pljava.jdbc.SQLXMLImpl<V>
All Implemented Interfaces:
SQLXML
Direct Known Subclasses:
SQLXMLImpl.Readable, SQLXMLImpl.Writable
public abstract class SQLXMLImpl<V extends Datum> extends Object implements SQLXML
Implementation of SQLXML for the SPI connection.

    (package private) static class 
    SQLXMLImpl.SAXUnwrapFilter
    Class to wrap an XMLReader and pass all of the parse events except the outermost ("document root") element, in effect producing XML(CONTENT) when the underlying stream has had a synthetic root element wrapped around it to satisfy a JRE-bundled parser that only accepts XML(DOCUMENT).
    (package private) static class 
    SQLXMLImpl.StAXResultAdapter
    Class to wrap a StAX XMLStreamWriter and hook the method writeEndDocument to also close the underlying output stream, making the SQLXML object ready to use for storing or returning the value.
    (package private) static class 
    SQLXMLImpl.StAXUnwrapFilter
    Class to wrap an XMLStreamReader and pass all of the parse events except the outermost ("document root") element, in effect producing XML(CONTENT) when the underlying stream has had a synthetic root element wrapped around it to satisfy a JRE-bundled parser that only accepts XML(DOCUMENT).

      protected abstract Datum adopt(int oid) throws SQLException
      Allow native code to claim complete control over the underlying Datum and dissociate it from Java.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      The underlying Datum (which has its own adopt method the native code will call next.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if this SQLXML instance is not in the proper state to be adoptable.

      Returns:

    • correctedDeclStream

      static InputStream correctedDeclStream(InputStream is, boolean neverWrap, Charset serverCS, boolean[] wrapping) throws IOException, SQLException
      Return an InputStream presenting the contents of the underlying varlena, but with the leading declaration corrected if need be.

      The current stored form in PG for the XML type is a character string in server encoding, which may or may not still include a declaration left over from an input or cast operation, which declaration may or may not be correct (about the encoding, anyway). Nothing is stored to distinguish whether the value is of the DOCUMENT or CONTENT form, to determine which requires a full reparse in the general case.

      This method only peeks at early parse events in the stream, to see if a DOCTYPE is present (must be DOCUMENT, or there is any other content before the first element (cannot be DOCUMENT). The input will not have a synthetic root element wrapped around it if a DOCTYPE is present, as that would break validation; otherwise (whether the check concluded it can't be DOCUMENT, or was simply inconclusive}, a synthetic wrapper will be added, as it will not break anything.

      As a side effect, this method sets m_wrapped to true if it applies a wrapper element. When returning a type of Source that presents parsed results, it will be configured to present them with the wrapper element filtered out.

      However, when using the API that exposes the serialized form directly (getBinaryStream, getCharacterStream, getString), this method is passed true for neverWrap, and no wrapping is done. The application code must then handle the possibility that the stream may fail to parse as a DOCUMENT. (The JDBC spec gives no guidance in this area.)

      Parameters:
      is - The InputStream to be corrected.
      neverWrap - When true, suppresses the wrapping described above.
      wrapping - An array of one boolean, which will be set true if the returned stream has had a wrapping document element applied that will have to be filtered away after parsing.
      Returns:
      An InputStream with its original decl, if any, replaced with a new one known to be correct, or none if the defaults are correct, and with the remaining content wrapped in a synthetic root element, unless the input is known early (by having a DOCTYPE) not to need one.
      Throws:
      IOException
      SQLException

    • useWrappingElement

      static boolean useWrappingElement(InputStream is, int markLimit) throws IOException
      Check (incompletely!) whether an InputStream is in XML DOCUMENT form (which Java XML parsers will accept) or CONTENT form, (which they won't, unless enclosed in a wrapping element).

      Proceed by requiring the input stream to support mark and reset, marking it, creating a StAX parser, and pulling some initial parse events.

      A possible START_DOCUMENT along with possible SPACE, COMMENT, and PROCESSING_INSTRUCTION events could allowably begin either the DOCUMENT or the CONTENT form.

      If a DTD is seen, the input must be in DOCUMENT form, and must not have a wrapper element added.

      If anything else is seen before the first START_ELEMENT, the input must be in CONTENT form, and must have a wrapper element added.

      If a START_ELEMENT is seen before either of those conclusions can be reached, this check is inconclusive. The conclusive check would be to finish parsing that element to see what, if anything, follows it. But that would often amount to parsing the whole stream just to determine how to parse it. Instead, just return @code true} anyway, as without a DTD, the wrapping trick is usable and won't break anything, even if it may not be necessary.

      Parameters:
      is - An InputStream that must be markable, will be marked on entry, and reset upon return.
      Returns:
      true if a wrapping element should be used.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • useWrappingElement

      static boolean useWrappingElement(Reader r) throws IOException
      Throws:
      IOException

    • domUnwrap

      static void domUnwrap(DOMSource ds)
      Unwrap a DOM tree parsed from input that was wrapped in a synthetic root element in case it had the form of XML(CONTENT).

      Because the wrapping is applied pessimistically (it is done whenever a quick preparse did not conclusively prove the input was DOCUMENT), repeat the check here, where it requires only traversing one list of immediate DOM node children. Produce a Document node if possible, a DocumentFragment only if the tree really does not have DOCUMENT form.

      Parameters:
      ds - A DOMSource produced by parsing wrapped input. The parse result will be retrieved using getNode(), then replaced using setNode() with the unwrapped result, either a Document or a DocumentFragment node.
